QuestionStem: Calculate averages to determine overall trends in the data.

options.PreQuestion: Which number most closely represents the﻿ average total annual loss over the years for which this data was reported?
Which number most closely represents the﻿ average total winter loss over the years for which this data was reported?

CorrectFeedback: Student averages should be approximately 37% total annual losses vs. 26% total winter losses over the years 2010–2015. The total annual loss is a measurement of the colony losses in the winter months added to the colony losses that occur in the summer months.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback:
To calculate the averages:

  • identify the years for which total annual losses were reported
  • add the percentages for total winter loss and divide by the number of years
  • add the percentages for total annual loss and divide by the number of years
IncorrectFeedback:
To calculate the averages:

  • identify the years for which total annual losses were reported
  • add the percentages for total winter loss and divide by the number of years
  • add the percentages for total annual loss and divide by the number of years
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Student averages should be approximately 37% total annual losses vs. 26% total winter losses over the years 2010–2015. The total annual loss is a measurement of the colony losses in the winter months added to the colony losses that occur in the summer months.
